subject: Science
title: Monitoring Volcanoes
description: A quick win: understand Monitoring Volcanoes.

hook.text: Unlike earthquakes, volcanoes often give weeks of warning before they blow.

buildup.text: Magma rising underground causes small earthquakes, ground swelling, and gas leaks.

discovery.text: Seismometers, GPS stations, and gas sensors surround dangerous volcanoes worldwide.

twist.text: But false alarms are common â€” magma can rise and stop without erupting.

climax.text: Evacuating a city on a maybe costs millions. Not evacuating on a yes costs lives.

punchline.text: Volcanoes warn us. The hard part is deciding when to listen.

quiz.question: What is a common warning sign of an impending volcanic eruption?
options: Increased small earthquakes near the volcano
